meanings.definition: The act of replacing an old obligation with a new one.
meanings.sent1: The novation of the loan agreement made it easier for the borrower to repay.
meanings.sent2: The company underwent novation of its debt to better manage its finances.
meanings.sent3: The novation of the lease contract turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
meanings.sent4: Her novation of responsibilities at work was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The novation of the insurance policy saved them from financial trouble.

meanings.definition: The substitution of a new contract or agreement for an old one.
meanings.sent1: After the novation of the partnership agreement, the business saw improved profits.
meanings.sent2: The novation of the rental contract was necessary due to changing circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The novation of the sales agreement brought unexpected benefits to both parties.
meanings.sent4: His novation of the employment contract was a strategic move for career growth.
meanings.sent5: The novation of the service contract ensured better terms for all involved.

meanings.definition: The process of transferring rights or obligations to a third party.
meanings.sent1: The novation of the copyright allowed the artist to focus on creating new work.
meanings.sent2: Legal novation of responsibilities can sometimes be complex but necessary.
meanings.sent3: The novation of the licensing rights led to unexpected collaborations.
meanings.sent4: His novation of the project management duties was a relief for the team.
meanings.sent5: The novation of the contract terms ensured fair treatment for all stakeholders.
